Abandoned

No response from submitter.

Please follow https://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/

    Separate subject from body with a blank line
    Limit the subject line to 50 characters
    Capitalize the subject line
    Do not end the subject line with a period
    Use the imperative mood in the subject line
    Wrap the body at 72 characters
    Use the body to explain what and why vs. how
Done
Redfish Validator ?
Done
Why remove the MACAddress ?
Done
huh? Why..?

forgot to remove this method.
this is not needed at all here
Done
This shouldnt be the case right? It should either be returning null and validation should be done in the caller method or it must be throwing an error?
this method is not used, removing
Done

we have followed same in multiple places.
can you please explain me wrong doing this way.

There are two reasons:

1. When you do as Gunnar suggests it often allows to return early and reduce code indentation which saves horizontal space.
2. Almost all other places in bmcweb follows this pattern to return early, it's easier to read because code which does same thing will look the same.
This needs to be addressed to return internal server error to the user.
Done
All systems will not be sending push style events.
Done
Commit message should be formatted using 50/72 style
Done
nit: Same as above, you could use enum class with enabled/dissabled values to make it more readable in places where it is called.
same as below
Ack

nit: This should be an enum to make it clear in places where it is used.

Also simple types like int,double,float,bool,enum should be passed via copy instead of reference there is more room for optimization when you pass something equal or smaller than sizeof(size_t).

>Also simple types like int,double,float,bool,enum should be passed via copy instead of reference there is more room for optimization when you pass something equal or smaller than sizeof(size_t).

Done

I havent changed it to enum - I have followed like how it is being used in other places of the code.
Ack
This is confusing will it enable or dissable interface?

This is setting the enabled property of this interface to false (which means disabled). This will be set to true by the pldm once this ip address is consumed by the hypervisor.

So whenever a user configures a new ip, the enabled property will be defaulted to false, and will be set to true by pldm.
nit: It's confusing what does this false stands for. I recommend using constexpr bool with proper name.

> what does this false stands for.

same as above^^^

Regular expression usually are avoided in bmcweb, because they are slow.

That should be simple to replace with for loop. Also as a note {0,61} will limit hostName to 63 characters, but if condition above says it should be up to 255 characters.
Done
Need to check for the invalid input errors here and send appropriate response code to the client. It should not be 500 always
Done
ditto
Done
const? Seems to me property does not change.
Done
I think this property should be handled when ipv4Data is empty
Done
Please avoid use brace initialization. See https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/52022
Done
These new-added lines are invalid for sdbusplus::asio::getProperty
Does this code even compile with the option enabled?
Done
Not sure why you have the double signed-off. Oh well.
Apart from the comment to return 500 to exit early on failure, i think other changes looks good.
You don't want different messages for these?
Please be careful with the extra white space changes. :)
